turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: No! Bond!

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: Bond!

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: What is this place?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: Former KGB surveillance post. The Dye Factory was just a front; now it turns a good profit.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: In the good old days, the KGB had three or four spots where our submarines could surface without anyone knowing. But Yevgeny is supposed to be loading cargo.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: What class sub does your nephew run?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: C-class.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Ill send someone out.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Could...could you come?

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Perhaps this isnt the time...

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Your people? Your people will leave you here to rot just like you left me. You and my father. He didnt think my life was worth the chump change he spent on a day at the stock market.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Your father...

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Is nothing.  His kingdom he stole from my mother. The kingdom I will rightly take back.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Now you know how it feels.  To be locked away, to wonder if theyre coming for you, if anyone will ever come for you.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Someone will come.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Who?  Bond?  Bond is dead.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Warm.

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: Is it?

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: So beautiful. So smooth, so warm.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: How would you know?

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: Why are you like this?  Because Bond is dead?  Its what you wanted.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Of course...

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: He was a...good lover?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: This is the end.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: No.  It is the beginning. The world will never be the same.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Everythings under control up here.  Are you ready?

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: Yes.  Au revoir...

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Weve been pawns in someones game. They tricked us into bringing the money to King. Not just elaborate.  Cock-sure.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: And expensive.  Cost three million plus.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Do we have the range of Renards plane?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Anywhere in this circle.  Iran, Iraq, Pakistan, Syria, Afghanistan...

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Marvellous.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: The parcels in the post.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Its heading for the oil terminal.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Where it can do the most damage.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Any word from him?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Still no contact yet.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Major Adamson, I can't seem to get in the door.

turns.speaker: ADAMSON
turns.text: Laurie, I'll have to ask you to come with me.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Why?  What's the problem?

turns.speaker: ADAMSON
turns.text: I can't tell you that.  It is quite urgent.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I would like to use the bathroom --

turns.speaker: ADAMSON
turns.text: The access code's been changed.  Your card won't work anymore.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: ADAMSON
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: What about our end?

turns.speaker: ANALYST
turns.text: Well, sir . . . in a worst-case scenario . . . we'd assume that twenty-five percent of the Russian birds get through.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: What kind of time frame are we talking about?

turns.speaker: ANALYST
turns.text: Thirty minutes maximum.  Of course, I assume we'd be in the fortified command bunker at the time of the launch order.

turns.speaker: ANALYST
turns.text: As you can see, we may be able to salvage a good-sized chunk of the farm belt.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: What about the aftermath?  This so-called . . . "nuclear winter" theory?

turns.speaker: ANALYST
turns.text: We don't really know, sir, but bluntly, our survival capability . . . may depend on a quirk of the weather.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: The weather.  I see.  Keep me posted.  I want hourly forecasts and a full report on optimum strike conditions.

turns.speaker: BURNS
turns.text: Had a lot of blood in him.

turns.speaker: HYDE
turns.text: You oughta see upstairs.  It's a slaughterhouse.

turns.speaker: BURNS
turns.text: No idea who's behind this?

turns.speaker: HYDE
turns.text: Small army, from the looks of it.  He put up one hell of a fight.

turns.speaker: BURNS
turns.text: He would -- You might as well know.  It's gonna get messy.  We got a call from Washington.

turns.speaker: HYDE
turns.text: Washington?

turns.speaker: BURNS
turns.text: They want in.  Seems our friend here was hardcore CTU.

turns.speaker: DR. LONG
turns.text: Walter --

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Don't call me that.

turns.speaker: DR. LONG
turns.text: Walter -- you're just telling me what you think I want to hear.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Wrong answers?

turns.speaker: DR. LONG
turns.text: There's no right or wrong.  But if you don't give me an honest response, I can't help you.  I want to help you.  I want to know all about you.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Hnnrr.  -- Like to masturbate.  Shit once a day.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: A whore fucking.

turns.speaker: DR. LONG
turns.text: Who is she?  Do you know her?

turns.speaker: DR. LONG
turns.text: And what -- split -- the dog's skull open?

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Why, doctor.  I did.  He was a bad dog.

turns.speaker: DR. LONG
turns.text: Walter.  This compulsion of yours -- to punish transgressors.  In your mind . . . what gives you the right to judge?

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: God isn't there to do it.

turns.speaker: DR. LONG
turns.text: We don't know that.

turns.speaker: DR. LONG
turns.text: That man, then, he was the first.  The first you --

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Saw the world that night -- random, empty, hideous.  God didn't make it that way.  We did.  We make the world -- in our own image.  What else can I illuminate?

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Hi, Jon.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Hello, Adrian.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: The bearer of bad news.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: We've lost a colleague.  The Comedian is dead.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Rorschach's on the case.  He's got Dreiberg in a lather.  He seems to think that someone is "stalking" the Watchmen.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Oh?  The CTU suspects a Libyan hit squad.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: What's your theory?

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Life and death are unquantifiable abstracts.  They don't concern me.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: I guess you'll be dismantling Russian tanks soon.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: You mean Afghanistan?  It won't require my attention.  What I'm doing here is far more interesting.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: WHAT ARE YOU DOING, VEIDT?

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Jon!  Get back!  You don't understand.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Blake?  Dead?

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Yes.  I heard this morning.  Washington's asked me to attend the funeral as a matter of protocol.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: I'm here, Laurie.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Is it time?  D'you have to leave for the funeral?

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Not yet, there's plenty of time.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Would you like me to stay?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Mm hmm.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: I could stay and go.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: . . . And just how would you manage that?

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: I'm not here.  I'm still on Mars.  I've come to collect you.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Collect me?

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: In the immediate future we're on Mars.  I'm telling you goodbye. You're trying to convince me to cure your illness . . .

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Jon, no -- I can't --

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: It will happen, Laurie.  I've already seen it.  Neither of us can do anything to change it.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: The atmosphere.  I'm sorry.  These things slip my mind.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Jesus, Jon, I nearly choked to -- where are we --

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: This whole place is ticking.  Does it -- keep time?

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Yes.  In about . . . thirty seconds, for example, you'll tell me you're sleeping with Dreiberg.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: You -- you know about me and Dan?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Jon, does anybody know what the hell you're talking about?  Dan's just an ordinary guy, but he talks to me.  When he looks at me he's seeing something more than just a -- a collection of atoms.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Then you're sleeping with Dreiberg?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Well, I just, you just said -- don't act surprised.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: That's how time works, Laurie.  Everything is preordained . . . even my responses.  We're all puppets.  I'm just a puppet who can see the strings.  -- Thirty seconds.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Jon -- there's something I have to know.  Did you love me once?

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Yes, I loved you.  I left the earth when I lost you.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Yet you must've known all along that you'd give me cancer.  Just be being with me.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: I didn't give you cancer, Laurie.  Not you, not the others.  I don't know what did.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: But you knew that I'd -- die.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Memories of the future are just like any others.  I've tried not to dwell on the unpleasant ones . . .  You won't die of cancer, Laurie.  There won't be time for that.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Then it's going to happen.  The world's going to end.  -- And you've always known.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Always.  Ever since the day I died.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Then why don't you . . . do something about it!

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Because --

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Because you can't, I know, it's preordained.  So sorry.  I forgot.  Jon.  This, this "script" you're following . . . who writes it?

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: I don't know yet.  I should be able to tell you in -- roughly six hundred years.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I can't stand any more of this.  I want to go back.  If I'm going to die I want to be with -- other people.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Please, Laurie.  Not yet.  I've got eons stretching before me, a universe to explore.  I'll be alone.  You're the last human being I'll ever see.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Jon, I do not want to hear it.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: I'm sorry.  Look -- there's a gas storm on the Valles Marineris . . .

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Oh God.  I'm no more than a bug on a windshield to you.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: You're the only human being I care for.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Then do me a favor.  If the world's going to end, it shouldn't matter a bit.  I want you to cure me.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: I won't do that.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: You have the power to do it.  I want you to do it.  Please.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: I explained this.  I can't.  That's not the way it happens.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Jon.  If you ever loved me -- if there's anything human left in you -- then do it.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: What -- am I --

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Cured, yes.

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: It¹s very strange.  Time¹s flowing backwards . . .

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Jon -- what??

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: The south pole.  Time¹s flowing backwards.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Jon, where are we?

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Veidt¹s complex.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Jon --

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: Space and time.  I finally understand, Laurie.  I see it all now.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Jon -- for God¹s sake, what do you see?

turns.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
turns.text: I see what the watchmaker made.  I see the universe!

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: The Comedian.  He's dead.  Murdered.  That's all I know.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: My God.  Murdered?  -- What's this have to do with Rorschach?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: It's -- he's got some kind of conspiracy theory.  He thinks someone's . . . I don't know, stalking us.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Us.  You mean the Watchmen.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: I know, I know, it's just -- he's back on the street, he smells blood.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: You know how he is.  He goes on these binges, kills a couple of thugs -- then he's satisfied.  It blows over.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: He's bound to get caught.  I don't want my name coming out.  Not at this late date.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: If he comes here, I'll handle him.  Remember -- I've always protected you.  Haven't I?  Do you need money?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: No.  I just wanted you to --

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: You did the right thing, Daniel.  Let's stay in touch, okay?  Good night.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Good night.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: I don't know, but . . . in the wake of all that's happened, I'm starting to think Rorschach may have been right.  Is Laurie okay?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: She's with me.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Good.  Be careful, Daniel, don't let up your guard.  Look, I'm going to head south for a while -- hole up at Karnak until all this blows over.  You two would be welcome to join me.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Thanks for the offer, Adrian.  I'll let you know.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Yeah.  See, I've been working on a little project.  Top secret, of course . . .

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: The missing scientists.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Uh huh.  You might recognize the names.  Quite a few of them worked at Gila Flats.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: What??

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: I couldn't let him interfere with my project.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: It is  Jon.  Twenty-four years ago.  Before he turned into Dr. Manhattan.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Good Lord.  How'd you get it on tape?

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: It's not on tape.  It's live.  We're watching it happen.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Gentlemen, the past.  Unfolding before your eyes.  Stand back from the field.  It'll blow you to bits.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: What is it?  How does it work?

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: It's a tachyon chamber.  It generates subatomic particles which flow backward in time.  There are other worlds, Daniel, other timelines -- existing parallel to our own --

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Adrian -- you've lost it.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: I've seen them!  I've seen them in there.

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Don¹t be obtuse, Daniel.  If I kill Jon in the past, none of this will happen.  We won¹t even be here, will we?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: And what if you¹re wrong?

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: I¹m not.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: What if you¹re wrong??

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Then I¹ve been a very bad boy and you¹ll have to spank me.  Christ!  I¹m doing what I have to do to save the godforsaken human race!!

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: Your problem, Dan, is a lack of vision.  You spent all those years chasing after muggers, and drug dealers, and jaywalkers . . . as if the world was any better for it.  As if any of it mattered.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: You ruthless son of a bitch.  You really believe this mad-scientist bullshit is going to save the world?

turns.speaker: VEIDT
turns.text: We'd better hope so.  -- It's almost time.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Sorry, it's this thing with Blake.  I mean, you don't really think anyone's out to get us -- do you?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Dan, are you really that paranoid?  Let's face it, Eddie Blake was no Mother Teresa.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Psychotic pig.  He had it coming.  Mr. CTU . . .

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Now wait.  We all had the same option as Blake.  It was work for the government or do time.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Fine, but the Civil Terrorism Unit?  It's a fucking Gestapo!  Dirty tricks -- political assassinations --

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Okay, okay.  You made your choice.  You went underground.  Some of us made other choices.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Damn straight.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Damn straight!  We were heroes.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Of course, we looked like idiots in those bondage outfits.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Well, that was Adrian's idea.  I know he's the smartest man in the world and all that, but -- talk about publicity hounds . . .

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Hey.  You remember that nut in the hockey mask?  With the asthma? What was his name . . .

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Oh yeah.  The one that used to confess to everything?  Hoping we'd beat him up?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: That's the one.  Whatever happened to him?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: He pulled it on Rorschach . . . and Rorschach dropped him down an elevator shaft.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Christ yes, I went in for a cancer scan first thing.  Gave me a couple of rough nights, I'll tell you . . .  How about you, Laurie?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  They gave me a clean bill of health and then booted me the hell out.  No expense account.  No place to live.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: You'll find something.  -- I should go.  You and me, seeing each other, someone might put two and two together . . .

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: They're not following me, Dan.  I mean -- Jon's gone, we're right on the brink of World War III.  Nobody cares about the Watchmen.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Maybe not, but why take chances?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Dan, what are you so scared of?  I mean, me, I've spent all these years keeping Jon together, and now that it's over I feel -- I feel glad.  I'm finally free to, to go out and live my own life, and --

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Laurie, wait.  I've got a spare room.  It's empty.  If you'd like . . . LAURIE Oh Daniel, thanks, but I couldn't.  You'd just be all nervous about --

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: No, screw that.  What you were saying before, it's absolutely right.  -- I'd love to have you stay.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: You're sure?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Oh.  No.  Sorry.  I'll be right down the hall if you want me . . . I mean, if you need some aspirin, or --

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I'm gonna take a warm bath and sack out.  -- You've been really sweet.  Sleep tight, okay?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: His what?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: His . . . whatever.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I'm not his . . . whatever.  Okay?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: I told you I was a little bit out of step.  A lot of the old stuff I listen to -- it never came out on crystal.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I'd say you stalled out about forty years ago.  Nellie Lutcher -- Louis Jordan -- I've never even heard of these people.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Play one.  Educate yourself.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: No wonder Adrian's rich.  You use that stuff?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Sure.  It works.  I mean, look at this face, Daniel.  I'm thirty-eight years old!

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: I don't mind getting older.  I'm obsolete anyway.  Why try to hide it?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I like the way you look.  It's strange with Jon.  He doesn't age.  His face doesn't change. But you, Daniel, you look . . .

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Old?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Not at all.  You look very -- dashing.  Here, you pick one.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: . . . What?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Pick a record.  I feel like dancing.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Eight cops?  Oh, great.  A jury's gonna love that.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Are you kidding?  If they put him in jail he's dead.  He'll never get to trial.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I just realized.  I'd never seen his face.  I guess it was just a matter of time.  He's totally -- Daniel? What's wrong?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: The Comedian . . . Jon . . . now Rorschach.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Ohh.  I could use some dinner.  Who was that on the phone?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: One more down.  Someone tried to kill Adrian.  . . . First time I've ever heard him scared.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: -- What is it.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I know what you're thinking.  You'd be a lot safer if I weren't around.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Laurie --

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I'm an open target, Dan.  If you're with me --

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: With any luck, the world'll end before we get ours.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Enough is enough, Daniel.  Where exactly are we?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Memory lane.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: The Owlship.  I can't believe it.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: -- I thought it was time for a routine maintenance check.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: I took her out a couple of summers back.  Scared the hell out of some cows.  -- I wonder if she'd make it down to Antarctica.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Antarctica??

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Adrian's headed down to his secret retreat.  He invited us to come along.  I've been thinking.  If things do get nasty . . . it wouldn't be a bad place to sit out a war.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Would you want to sit out a war?  I mean -- what would be left.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: You and me.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Dan!  The spare costumes!  I can't believe you kept them.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Me neither.  Mine barely even fits.  The thing is, I try to remember why we did it, and I can't.  Helping people, or righting wrongs, or trying to save the world . . . I don't know.  It all seems so abstract.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: God, you sound like Jon.  -- Turn around.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: What are you up to?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Don't look.  Turn around.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: This'd better not be what I think it is.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Okay!

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: What the hell -- ?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: It's a peace rally.  The CTU's just opened fire on the crowd.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Oh, Laurie.  Jesus.  No.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: They're following us.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: All right.  Mission accomplished.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Missed 'em Dan.  You're aiming high!

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: I don't want to take 'em out.  Just want to keep 'em interested.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: They're practically on us . . .

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: That Detroit shit?  I'm so worried.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: The costumes.  Am I right?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: No way.  I'm not that much of a pervert.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Yes you are.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: No offense, Laurie, but it was Silk Spectre I had the crush on.  Tonight was the first time I've felt like myself in ten years.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: That's because --

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: It's because there's nothing to be afraid of anymore.  The world's about to end.  I feel like I could save it.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: You're full of yourself.  What are you doing?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Long as we're on the subject of perverts . . .  I miss Rorschach.  Let's spring him.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: . . . What??

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: What's he doing?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: I think he's going to the john.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: My God!  We bust him out of jail, in the middle of a riot, and he stops to take a --

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: I beg your pardon . . . ?  Some gratitude.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Will you two lovebirds keep it down?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Welcome back, Night Owl.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: What now?  Fly south -- hook up with Adrian?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: What was he doing?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Trying to change the past.  He said it was the only way to save the world --

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: He saved himself.  He changed the past.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Where did he go?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Dan, is this -- is this New York??

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Those cars.  What year is this??

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Everything's changed --

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Dan -- what do we do now?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Wherever we are, it's better than what we left.  Backs together --

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: We'll tell them what's happened.  They'll listen to reason, won't they -- ?

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Hiya, pardner.  Long time no see.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Did anybody follow you?  See you come here?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Sure.  You got some kind of -- bean juice on it.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Human bean juice.  The Comedian is dead.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: So do I.  So do you.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Rorschach, that was a long time ago.  I mean, that -- that's just paranoia.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Maybe.  Or maybe somebody's finally caught up with us.  Somebody with a grudge.  Thought you might want to spread the word.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Hey.  Hey.  If you don't mind, use the back stairs, all right?

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: . . . That was quick.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Toilet clogged.  Short fat turd.  Let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: I don't know if you heard.  A hired gunman tried to off Adrian.

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Veidt's a fool.  Tried to warn him about new information.  Sicced his mangy cat on me.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: What new information?

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Blake investigating missing scientists for CTU.  Dr. Manhattan somehow involved . . .

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: CTU.  Could be behind Dr. Manhattan frame-up.

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: What do you mean, frame-up?

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: Obvious pattern -- all ties in --

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Are you saying that someone would risk starting World War III just to get back at us?  What about all those poor shits with cancer?

turns.speaker: RORSCHACH
turns.text: How do we know they've got cancer?  Could be part of massive propaganda scheme . . .

turns.speaker: DREIBERG
turns.text: Come on, Rorschach.  Gimme a break --
